Answers. Best Answer: Usually basements are dug before the house is built. Putting one now could cause the house to collapse. The 1st step is hire a good local engineer to look at the home and draw plans for the project. He will let you know whether the project is feasible or not. If it is, take the plans to several reputable local contractors who are licensed to do the work and get bids.

New Basement under existing house. by JWmHarmon » Mon Nov 08, 2004 1:16 am. It is possible to build a new basement under an existing house. The house would have to be jacked up and have steel I-beams placed under the walls and floors. If your house is built on a slab you may have to build a temporary floor to hold the walls together
